course_title: Advanced musculoskeletal clinical reasoning in practice

learning_outcomes.description: Conduct a patient interview that uses a systematic ‘reflection in action’ clinical reasoning approach to information gathering collaboratively with the patient.
Demonstrate advanced communication skills when conducting a patient interview, including the communication of findings with patients, colleagues and other relevant stakeholders.

Critically appraise and clinically reason patient interview findings in a manner that informs patient safety, diagnosis, physical assessment priorities, and shared decision making with regard to patient goals and potential management strategies.
Demonstrate capacity to further explore and evaluate relevant patient interview findings and outcomes with the use of appropriate resources (eg. questionnaires, instruments).
Demonstrate scholarly skills within a Clinical Community of Practice in clinical education and peer review, including feedback and assessment literacy.

assessments.due_date:
23/02/2026 - 11/05/2026

Due dates will fall between Week 1 commencing 27/02/2026 to Week 11 15/05/26.
assessments.category: Participation/ Student contribution, Performance, Placement, Presentation, Reflection
assessments.task_description:
Over the course students will present at least 3 pre-recorded patient interviews to their Clinical Community of Practice (CCOP), followed by questioning lead by another student performing the role of the Clinical Coach, followed by discussion within the entire CCOP. The Clinician will be assessed by the Clinical Educator using the rubric that includes the quality of the recorded interview as well as the quality of their responses to questions and feedback provided by the Clinical Coach and other CCOP members.

Time for this assessment item includes: 1.5 hours to organise and record a 20-minute patient interview; 3.5 hours preparation for meeting underpinned by a case-based clinical reasoning presentation style; 1 hour for presentation (20mins for listening to recording of interview, 20mins for Clinical Coach led questions, 20mins for CCOP discussion) = 6 hours/case as Clinician x 3 occasions = 18 hours.

In this course the recording of an assessment (oral/practical) performance has been waived, a record of student performance will be taken by other means such as audio recording or detailed written notes that can be referred to if a remark is required at a later date.

Under no circumstances should identifiable clinical information be uploaded to open or external AI platforms, as it is unethical and irresponsible. Given this assessment is related to a placement with clinical information please see more information on use of AI in student placements under additional assessment information.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Clinical Coach - Clinical Community of Practice
assessments.due_date:
23/02/2026 - 11/05/2026

Due dates will fall between Week 1 commencing 27/02/2026 to Week 11 15/05/26.
assessments.category: Participation/ Student contribution, Performance, Placement, Presentation, Reflection
assessments.task_description:
Each student will clinically coach at least 3 of the Clinical Community of Practice Sessions. The Clinical Coach will be responsible for leading the questioning of the presenting clinician following the patient interview being played. The Clinical Coach will be assessed by the Clinical Educator using the rubric that includes the quality of the questioning of the clinician post recorded interview, as well as their conduct with other CCOP members during the session.

Time for this assessment item includes: 1 hour preparation time + 1 hour for presentation (20mins for listening to recording of interview, 20mins for Clinical Coach led questions, 20mins for CCOP discussion). Therefore 3 x 2-hour sessions = 6 hours. 

In this course the recording of an assessment (oral/practical) performance has been waived, a record of student performance will be taken by other means such as audio recording or detailed written notes that can be referred to if a remark is required at a later date.

Under no circumstances should identifiable clinical information be uploaded to open or external AI platforms, as it is unethical and irresponsible. Given this assessment is related to a placement with clinical information please see more information on use of AI in student placements under additional assessment information.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Clinical Examiner - Clinical Community of Practice
assessments.due_date:
23/02/2026 - 11/05/2026

Due dates will fall between Week 1 commencing 27/02/2026 to Week 11 15/05/26.
assessments.category: Participation/ Student contribution, Performance, Placement, Presentation, Reflection
assessments.task_description:
Each student will mock clinically examine the clinician's performance for at least 3 of the CCOP sessions using the same marking Rubric used by the Clinical Educator.

A Pass/Fail grade is given for this item based on the student's participation in this assessment item.

Under no circumstances should identifiable clinical information be uploaded to open or external AI platforms, as it is unethical and irresponsible. Given this assessment is related to a placement with clinical information please see more information on use of AI in student placements under additional assessment information.

assessments.task_description:
Students will complete 5 clinical reasoning forms (PART A Only relating to the patient Interview) every 2 weeks (weeks 2, 4, 6, 8, 10) for a patient they have seen in their clinical caseload (note this is a separate patient to that used in their case presentations) and submit to the course coordinator. Time given for this is 4 hours/form accounting for 2 hours form completion and 2 hours reviewing relevant information from the literature = Total 20 hours.

Under no circumstances should identifiable clinical information be uploaded to open or external AI platforms, as it is unethical and irresponsible. Given this assessment is related to a placement with clinical information please see more information on use of AI in student placements under additional assessment information.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 11(23 Feb - 17 May)
learning_activities.topic:
Clinical Community of Practice Online Mentoring Sessions

Students will be divided into Clinical Community of Practice (CCOP) groups of 3-6 over the course. Groups will interact in mentored and clinically coached sessions with a focus on clinical reasoning mastery during the Patient Interview using their current patient caseload. This learning activity will occur 6 times over the semester (approx. every 2 weeks) with each session lasting 2 hours.

Each of the 2-hour sessions will comprise 2 cases (1 hour each). Each case will commence with the student performing the part of the 'Clinician', playing a pre-recorded patient interview (20 mins maximum duration) to the entire CCOP, the student playing the role of the 'Clinical Coach' will then ask a series of exploratory questions to help the 'Clinian' reflect on the conduct and the quality of the patient interview and their associated clinical reasoning (20 minutes duration), after the coached session there will be a further 20 minutes for all members of the CCOP to ask questions, provide feedback., and have group discussion. For each case students will either be taking on the role of Clinician (presenter), Clinical Coach, or mock Clinical Examiner (2 per case). Each of the sessions is supervised by a UQ physiotherapy clinical educator. While the UQ staff clinical educator will facilitate the session when needed, the emphasis is on peer learning. This learning activity will require reflective practice and draw on the skills & expertise of the student peer group.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 2 To Week 10(02 Mar - 10 May)
learning_activities.topic:
Clinical Reasoning Forms

Students will complete a clinical reasoning form for a patient they have seen in their clinic (note this is a separate patient to that used in their case presentations) and submit to the course coordinator. Students will submit 5 clinical reasoning forms across the semester in weeks 2, 4, 6, 8 10.

Clinical reasoning forms ask a series of questions of the clinician to prompt reflection and justification on their thought process throughout a patient interaction at various time points. These clinical reasoning forms are then used in the subsequent clinical placement course. In this course students will only complete Part A of the clinical reasoning form which is the section dedicated to the Patient Interview.


Learning outcomes: L03, L04
